articles.description: Follow live commentary & text updates as France face Morocco in the round of 16 of the 2023 Women's World Cup.
articles.title: Watch: Fifa Women's World Cup - France v Morocco round of 16

articles.description: England forward Lauren James apologises for her red card during the Women's World Cup last-16 win over Nigeria.
articles.title: England's James apologises for World Cup red card

articles.description: Watch live coverage from the sixth day of the 2023 Cycling World Championships in Glasgow.
articles.title: Watch: 2023 Cycling World Championships

articles.description: Colombia set up a Women's World Cup quarter-final against England with a hard-fought 1-0 victory over Jamaica thanks to Catalina Usme's goal.
articles.title: Colombia set up England match by beating Jamaica

articles.description: Latest transfer news as Tottenham reject latest Bayern bid for Harry Kane, Southampton knock back Liverpool for Romeo Lavia and Moises Caicedo's frustration grows at Brighton.
articles.title: Transfers latest and Premier League build-up

articles.description: Kenza Dali rounds off a "delightful" move to double France's lead over Morocco at the Women's World Cup.
articles.title: Dali doubles France's lead over Morocco

articles.description: Defender Tino Livramento signs a five-year contract to become Newcastle's third summer signing.
articles.title: Newcastle sign Southampton's Livramento for £40m

articles.description: Anthony Joshua will fight Robert Helenius on Saturday night in London after Dillian Whyte failed a drug test.
articles.title: Joshua to fight Helenius as Finn replaces Whyte

articles.description: Watch highlights as Colombia's Catalina Usme nets a second-half winner to set up a Women's World Cup quarter-final against England after a hard-fought 1-0 victory over Jamaica.
articles.title: Colombia beat Jamaica to set up England quarter-final

articles.description: Chelsea striker Christopher Nkunku will be out for "an extended period" after undergoing surgery on his injured knee.
articles.title: Nkunku out for 'extended period' after knee surgery
